image.altText: A side-on photo of a man wearing a blue blazer and orange tie. There are blurred out trees in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the Northern Territory's biggest land councils has expressed alarm at the government's planned legislative changes, while pastoralists say the current sacred site laws are a "joke".

title.children: 'A complete joke': Shots fired in battle over changes to NT sacred site laws

image.altText: Fantasia Rose Portaminni 2

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of kids in care in Australia. For those leaving care at 18 years old, it can be a confusing and scary time.

title.children: Teens struggle to adjust to adult life after leaving out-of-home care

image.altText: Aboriginal man in hi-vis with a smiling boy on his shoulders

props.synopsis: The family of a boy with autism who went missing from a remote Kimberley community on the weekend have thanked everyone involved in his safe return after a community-wide search.

title.children: Searchers track lost boy's footprints to find him clutching tree in river

image.altText: A woman is unidentifiable wearing a hat and white long sleeved shirt, looking out to sea.

props.synopsis: Bec says the initial assault paled in comparison to navigating the court system in regional Australia and dealing with her aggressor in a tiny town.

title.children: Small town violence: When leaving feels like your only option

image.altText: An illustration of a teenage boy wrapped up in warm clothes sitting on a bench in front of a brick wall at night.

props.synopsis: Youth Allowance recipients facing homelessness are missing out on social housing tenancies over older jobseekers and age pensioners whose benefits pay more.

title.children: 'Youth housing penalty' locking young people out of social tenancies

image.altText: Jim Chalmers reads the budget book in his office.

props.synopsis: With an expected decade of deficits on the horizon, Treasurer Jim Chalmers will try to convince voters that today's federal budget manages to balance the need to keep a lid on spending while giving struggling households enough support.

title.children: Staring down years of deficits, Chalmers spruiks budget as a 'platform for prosperity'

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis:
Samsung Electronics co-CEO dies of cardiac arrest, with no successor named. 

Chinese electric vehicle maker BYD posts a larger annual revenue than Tesla. 

Follow the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters on our live blog.

title.children: Samsung co-CEO dies, Chinese EV maker surpasses Tesla's annual revenue

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian share market closes up slightly, losing early gains
Samsung Electronics co-CEO has died of cardiac arrest

image.altText: A blindfolded man is loaded into the back of a van at night time

props.synopsis: A documentary maker is among three Palestinians beaten and detained in the West Bank, according to a co-director who says he witnessed the arrest.

title.children: Oscar-winning director beaten by Israeli settlers, witnesses say

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large industrial work site in Port Pirie.

props.synopsis: Plans for a $750 million green hydrogen facility at Port Pirie, which was initially announced in 2021, have been shelved, the state government says.

title.children: Green hydrogen project at Port Pirie smelter shelved

image.altText: A mob of sheep in a yard.

props.synopsis: Scientists call for the federal government to invest more in preventing the disease from spreading to Australia's $5 billion sheep meat industry.

title.children: Australia on alert after UK detects world's first case of bird flu in sheep

image.altText: An anonymous woman silouhette, with her looking onto a busy street in Kings Cross, with people walking by, blurred.

props.synopsis: An American man filmed women in Sydney's east with recording glasses and posted the footage to social media without the women's consent.

title.children: 'Soul-destroying': Sydney women secretly filmed by man with camera in glasses

image.altText: A hole is seen in a wall at Gaza's Nasser Hospital after the strike

props.synopsis: The director of Gaza's Nasser Hospital says there was already a shortage of oxygen after an earlier Israeli strike.

title.children: Nasser Hospital strike survivor saw friend 'flying' through the air

image.altText: Man using Facebook with a ban symbol

props.synopsis: Facebook users in Papua New Guinea remain offline after the government carried out what it described as "testing" to regulate hate speech and offensive content.

title.children: Facebook shut down in PNG in 'test' to stop 'pornography, misinformation'

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: Parenting experts and psychologists say we should be talking with our teenagers about the themes raised in the crime drama.

title.children: Netflix's Adolescence raises tough questions for parents. Let's unpack them

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone

props.synopsis: The genomic testing company says the way it stores data hasn't changed and any new buyers would have to follow the "applicable law" about security.

title.children: What does 23andMe's collapse mean for customers' data?

image.altText: Building with people walking in front

props.synopsis: The University of Wollongong will cut up to 10 per cent of its non-academic staff in its latest round of redundancies, which it claims is a consequence of changes to international student visa processing.

title.children: University cuts up to 180 more jobs amid student visa changes

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A close-up of Basil Zempilas wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: After winning his seat by an extremely thin margin, newly minted Churchlands MP Basil Zempilas is voted in by his party colleagues as leader of the WA Liberals.

title.children: Newly minted MP Basil Zempilas voted in unopposed as WA Liberal leader

image.altText: A wrecked yellow panel van sits in bushland near Collie, believed to be at the centre of the Lisa Mott disappearance.

props.synopsis: Police investigating the suspected murder of 12-year-old Lisa Mott in the WA town of Collie in 1980 appeal for help as they try to identify the owner of a yellow panel van previously found dumped in bushland.

title.children: Abandoned panel van could hold clues to teen's disappearance 44 years ago

image.altText: A crashed plane lies on sand is fenced off as emergency services work around it.

props.synopsis: A pilot who died in a plane crash at Jandakot Airport last year was likely distracted by a loose engine cover, a report finds.

title.children: Pilot who died after plane crash likely distracted by flapping engine cover

image.altText: Supermarket worker stands in front of the lettuce section.

props.synopsis: Some farmers say the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission report hasn't gone far enough, with more transparency wanted between supermarkets and shoppers. Others are happy to see changes made to the way they do business with Coles, Aldi and Woolworths.

title.children: Frustrated fruit grower wants supermarkets to display what they pay farmers

image.altText: A man looks on during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: For 15 years, Daly Cherry-Evans has been Manly's guiding star. Now, with the Sea Eagles legend set to exit the club, both Cherry-Evans and the Silvertails are off the edge of the map for the first time in an age.

title.children: It's taken a generation but Manly and Cherry-Evans must face the unknown

image.altText: Danny Nikolic wearing a brown long sleeve leaning against a street pole

props.synopsis: Former champion jockey Danny Nikolic and lawyer Patrick Lennon have appeared before the Melbourne Magistrates' Court after allegedly attempting to steal luxury items valued at $177,000.

title.children: Jewellery, Toyota Hilux among items champion jockey allegedly attempted to steal

image.altText: Saturn backlit by the Sun showing its various rings in different colours.

props.synopsis: Planets don't get much more iconic than Saturn. But if you managed to see it through a backyard telescope right now, you wouldn't see its rings.

title.children: Why have Saturn's rings disappeared from view?

image.altText: Pete Hegseth, standing above Donald Trump, spread his hands.

props.synopsis: The incident has been condemned as one of the most "stunning and dangerous" breaches of military intelligence ever seen.

title.children: Trump officials accidentally texted a journalist war plans

image.altText: David Gonski with grey hair and black-rimmed glasses, and smiling slightly, turns his head to face a person just visible nearby

props.synopsis: In 2011 David Gonski proposed school funding reforms with one goal in mind: giving all children an equal shot at an education. Now, after 14 years of false starts, his model will finally be implemented.

title.children: 'Public schools do the really heavy lifting' and will finally be 'fairly' funded

image.altText: Gerard Depardieu arrives in court dressed in black

props.synopsis: Prosecutors allege the assaults against two women - whose full identities have not been revealed - took place during the filming in 2021 of "Les Volets Verts" (The Green Shutters).

title.children: French actor Gerard Depardieu goes on trial for sexual assault

image.altText: Two men in white shirts and black ties smiling with an arm around each other in a supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: As rising costs and shrinking margins continue to hit independent grocers, competing with Coles and Woolworths is getting tougher. But that is not stopping them from trying.

title.children: Independent to open 69th store in face-off with big supermarkets

image.altText: Cars stopped close to one another in peak hour traffic

props.synopsis: Noise pollution can impact our physical and mental wellbeing, so periods of silence throughout the day may just be the antidote.

title.children: The mental and physical benefits of the sound of silence

image.altText: Sadia Sulaiman carries a blue polio vaccine esky.

props.synopsis: Pakistan is one of only two countries where polio remains endemic and it is aiming to eradicate it by 2027, but with cases soaring last year, experts and officials worry it will miss its goal.

title.children: How the CIA inadvertently caused fear of the polio vaccine in Pakistan

image.altText: A group of protesters holding Turkish flags on the street. They are wet after being doused by a water cannon.

props.synopsis: The arrest of one of President Tayyip Erdogan's high-profile political rivals has sparked the biggest street protests in the country in more than a decade.

title.children: More than 1,100 protesters arrested as Türkiye demonstrations escalate

image.altText: a woman claps while a man in a blue tie waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: Usha Vance, the wife of US Vice President JD Vance, is set to make a high profile visit to Greenland this week.

title.children: Greenland's PM slams visit by US officials, including Usha Vance

image.altText: A hung up portrait of a man in formal attire with a gold frame.

props.synopsis: The US president took to Truth Social to call for the removal of his "purposefully distorted" portrait.

title.children: 'Obama looks wonderful, but mine is the worst': Trump demands removal of portrait

image.altText: Comedian Sashi Perera and her husband Charlie embrance on the dance floor of their post-elopement party.

props.synopsis: When my husband and I eloped in 2020, we promised ourselves that we'd have a big party later. After the pandemic, miscarriages and my father's death, it was time to manufacture some joy.

title.children: Our newlywed years were grief-filled, so we threw a 'not wedding' party
